alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 6:47PM CDT until May 19 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central McCulloch County in west central Texas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 642 PM CDT, Radar indicated a nearly stationary band of thunderstorms, producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches has already occurred across some of this area, and an additional 1 to 2 inches is expected in a short period of time. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brady and Brady Lake. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... South Blackburn between Adkins and 13th, White Street at Live Oak Creek, FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, Hallum Draw, South High between 14th and 15th Streets, 17th Street between Pine and College, crossings along County Road 158, County Road 158 crossing Bowtie Creek, County Road 416 crossing Little Onion Creek and County Road 414 crossing Little Onion Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
